body: Francesco, I just checked how the CBE tool works when you plot operative temperature on the x-axis.  The tool simply does not allow you to set separate air and radiant temperatures and I guess that I could do something similar on a psych chart component. To illustrate what I meant, you could take a case like the one below: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/99aVnO*4LGcHXveC9k6XbfppAFhEcPM8z5Xht4NvNUxsU7hzhoT05WgXZRGWIN2VxBK3E0GgTXm4csE1PAzdbXH9sAPvPutT/CBEToolOpTemp.JPG) If I increased the air temperature without increasing the radiant temperature, the red dot would fall off of the psych chart (it would essentially be above the saturation line).  This is because the warm, 100% humid air can hold more water vapor than air than 100% humid air at the cooler operative temperature.  Does that make snese? -Chris
